graphStructure.cypher:
CREATE (doc:Document {
      id: "Privacy GDPR Policy",
      title: "Privacy GDPR Policy",
      domain: "compliance",
      doc_type: "Compliance Policy"
    })
CREATE (e0:Requirement {name: "Lawfulness Transparency", description: "Obtain explicit consent for collecting personal data, provide privacy notices, and document legal processing.", regulation: "GDPR", reference: "Article 6, Article 12"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e0)
CREATE (e1:Requirement {name: "Purpose Limitation", description: "Use personal data only for specified purposes, do not use for incompatible purposes, and delete when no longer necessary.", regulation: "GDPR", reference: "Article 5(1)(b)"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e1)
CREATE (e2:Requirement {name: "Data Minimization", description: "Collect only necessary personal data, review collection practices, and implement retention schedules.", regulation: "GDPR", reference: "Article 5(1)(c)"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e2)
CREATE (e3:Requirement {name: "Accuracy", description: "Maintain accurate and up-to-date records, and allow individuals to correct their data.", regulation: "GDPR", reference: "Article 5(1)(d)"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e3)
CREATE (e4:Requirement {name: "Storage Limitation", description: "Retain personal data for specified periods: 7 years maximum for general data, 2 years for marketing after last contact, and as required by law for financial records.", regulation: "GDPR", reference: "Article 5(1)(e)"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e4)
CREATE (e5:Requirement {name: "Security", description: "Implement encryption at rest and in transit, access controls, authentication, security assessments, and incident response procedures.", regulation: "GDPR", reference: "Article 32"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e5)
CREATE (e6:Requirement {name: "Subject Rights", description: "Ensure rights to access, rectification, erasure, data portability, and objection for data subjects.", regulation: "GDPR", reference: "Articles 15-21"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e6)
CREATE (e7:Finding {name: "No Explicit Consent Documented", description: "Policy requires explicit consent but no evidence of documented consent processes in place.", status: "Open", severity: "High"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e7)
CREATE (e8:Finding {name: "Inadequate Retention Enforcement", description: "Retention periods specified, but no mechanisms to ensure deletion after maximum periods.", status: "Open", severity: "Medium"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e8)
CREATE (e9:Risk {name: "Non-Compliance Penalties", description: "Risk of fines and legal actions due to failure to meet GDPR requirements.", likelihood: "High", impact: "High"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e9)
CREATE (e10:Risk {name: "Data Breach", description: "Risk of unauthorized access or data loss due to insufficient security controls.", likelihood: "Medium", impact: "High"})
CREATE (doc)-[:MENTIONS]->(e10)

properties.name: Lawfulness Transparency
properties.description: Obtain explicit consent for collecting personal data, provide privacy notices, and document legal processing.

properties.name: Purpose Limitation
properties.description: Use personal data only for specified purposes, do not use for incompatible purposes, and delete when no longer necessary.

properties.name: Data Minimization
properties.description: Collect only necessary personal data, review collection practices, and implement retention schedules.

properties.name: Accuracy
properties.description: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records, and allow individuals to correct their data.

properties.name: Storage Limitation
properties.description: Retain personal data for specified periods: 7 years maximum for general data, 2 years for marketing after last contact, and as required by law for financial records.

properties.name: Security
properties.description: Implement encryption at rest and in transit, access controls, authentication, security assessments, and incident response procedures.

properties.name: Subject Rights
properties.description: Ensure rights to access, rectification, erasure, data portability, and objection for data subjects.

properties.name: No Explicit Consent Documented
properties.description: Policy requires explicit consent but no evidence of documented consent processes in place.

properties.name: Inadequate Retention Enforcement
properties.description: Retention periods specified, but no mechanisms to ensure deletion after maximum periods.

properties.name: Non-Compliance Penalties
properties.description: Risk of fines and legal actions due to failure to meet GDPR requirements.

properties.name: Data Breach
properties.description: Risk of unauthorized access or data loss due to insufficient security controls.

fulltextMetadata.title: Privacy GDPR Policy

requirement_description: Obtain explicit consent for collecting personal data, provide privacy notices, and document legal processing.
Use personal data only for specified purposes, do not use for incompatible purposes, and delete when no longer necessary.
Collect only necessary personal data, review collection practices, and implement retention schedules.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records, and allow individuals to correct their data.
Retain personal data for specified periods: 7 years maximum for general data, 2 years for marketing after last contact, and as required by law for financial records.
Implement encryption at rest and in transit, access controls, authentication, security assessments, and incident response procedures.
Ensure rights to access, rectification, erasure, data portability, and objection for data subjects.
finding_description: Policy requires explicit consent but no evidence of documented consent processes in place.
Retention periods specified, but no mechanisms to ensure deletion after maximum periods.
risk_description: Risk of fines and legal actions due to failure to meet GDPR requirements.
Risk of unauthorized access or data loss due to insufficient security controls.

fulltextMetadata.summary: This policy establishes GDPR and data protection compliance requirements for all personnel handling personal data. It outlines six core principles including lawful processing, data minimization, and security measures like encryption and access controls. The policy also defines data subject rights and designates a compliance officer for implementation and oversight.
